thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger answered 3 questions in post-Bayern press conference | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger answered 3 questions in post-Bayern press conference | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger answered 3 questions in post-Bayern press conference | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 8:24 am To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Arsene Wenger answered just three questions in his press conference after Arsenal were beaten 5-1 by Bayern Munich in the Champions League. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The Arsenal boss spoke for just 2:42 minutes after the humiliating defeat and was whisked away by communications director Mark Gonnella after he answered the third question. 
Wenger looked dejected as he started off by saying he believed the 5-1 thrashing was a ‘strange’ game’. 
Arsenal were level at half-time thanks to Alexis Sanchez, but conceded four goals in the second 45 minutes. 
‘It was a strange game, in the first half we played well,’ he said. Arsene Wenger looks on from the touchline (Picture: Getty) 
‘We had two good chances before half-time. 
‘In the second half we suffered two blows in Koscielny and the two goals we conceded in the 53rd and 56th minutes. Arsenal were hopeless in the second half (Picture: Getty)
